title: Patriots won’t be able to take any steps forward if they can’t get out of their own way
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots “We don't need to lose a football game to know that turnovers are very hard to overcome.
" Drake Maye was knocked for two turnovers on Sunday against the Steelers.

Photo by Matthew J Lee/Globe staff By Conor Ryan September 21, 2025 5 minutes to read COMMENTARYIn the Patriots’ video room at Gillette Stadium, Mike Vrabel and his coaching staff have made a few impromptu renovations.

title: What DeMario Douglas said about going backwards on failed fourth down play during Patriots’ final drive
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "I thought bro was like right behind me and that's what made me move.
" DeMario Douglas AP Photo/Robert F.
Bukaty FOXBOROUGH – DeMario Douglas’s foot was inches away from where it needed to be.

title: Police investigate potential hate crime after gay couple attacked in Mattapan
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News A fight broke out after a group of men allegedly “began making anti-homosexual remarks towards them," the couple told police.

By Molly Farrar September 21, 2025 | 7:18 PM 1 minute to read A gay couple walking in Mattapan was allegedly targeted with homophobic language earlier this month before one was hit in the back of the head with a baseball bat during a fight, police said.
One of the men in the couple told police that he and his partner were walking toward a convenience and liquor store on River Street just before 8 p.

title: Jabrill Peppers gets the last laugh against Patriots at Gillette Stadium
author: Conor Ryan

title: Morrissey cancels shows in Boston, Connecticut due to ‘credible’ death threats
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News Morrissey’s stops at Foxwoods in Mashantucket, Connecticut and MGM Music Hall were canceled.
British singer Morrissey in 2012.

AP Photo/Jorge Saenz, File By Molly Farrar September 21, 2025 | 6:28 PM 1 minute to read English singer Morrissey canceled two New England shows after “credible threats” against his life, according to the performer and the Boston venue set to host him.

title: Julian Edelman reflects on his Patriots Hall of Fame career: ‘Foxborough will always be my home’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Edelman, who was inducted into the Patriots Hall of Fame on Sunday, made some brief remarks on Sunday.
Julian Edelman speaks at halftime of the Patriots-Steelers game after being inducted into the team's Hall of Fame.

Matthew J Lee/Globe staff FOXBOROUGH – Sporting his brand new red Patriots Hall of Fame jacket, a pair of blue jeans, and black sunglasses, Julian Edelman jogged up to the podium at halftime and hugged team owner Robert Kraft.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ frustrating 21-14 loss to Steelers
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots The Patriots were knocked for five total turnovers in Sunday’s loss to the Steelers.
Drake Maye was knocked for two turnovers on Sunday.
